website_summaries.verdict: The Socket is a gadget you want to hide, but in so doing, you lose its primary appeal -- the ability to display unique light bulbs. Why anyone would shell out $80 for this product, I cannot imagine.
pros: The iDevices Socket works pretty well as a dimmer and nightlight
cons: Its design is bulky and inefficient, and its price is absurd

customer_reviews.title: They were wonderful. But
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to set up. I had lengthy conversations with iDevices. They were wonderful. But, for some reason in my home, Alexa keeps loosing the iDevice Socket. I'm not sure whose fault that is? Ended up controlling my two devices on the iPad rather than my S7Edge. But, my iPad keeps going to my 5G wi-fi and iDevice does not support this and perhaps that is why Alexa keeps loosing the iDevice Socket. I wish Alexa made all the products and therefore would be more compatible?
customer_reviews.author: Silly Sal

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: Though the light is effective. It took almost an hour to get to work. The app wouldn’t connected properly and kept saying “setting up device”. I finally had to change settings on my wifi to get it set up (I was using a secured network). Once that was finished I then spent 30 min figuring out how to get Alexa to work with the device. Though she can control the light, the nightlight portion still won’t work. Overall 3 stars due to poor set up design and even worse step by step set up instructions.
customer_reviews.author: God21frey

customer_reviews.title: It works great and easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up. I have an Apple ecosystem at home so I'm using my large iPad Pro (I rarely take it with me) as the hub for homekit so my lamp upstairs turns on in the evening and then turns itself back off at dawn. It was a snap to set up and works great. I had planned to use it in my back porch light but the added height meant I couldn't fit the socket and bulb and then put the cap back on the light. Instead I'm using it in a lamp and it works great. I will have to rethink the back porch light.
customer_reviews.author: BAtristain

customer_reviews.title: SO much easier than other options
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and setup. It was great to have an option on how bright to have the light turn on at. If it has one drawback it's that if someone uses the light throughout the day, it doesn't turn on at the set time if not set back to the correct setting - but that's something we'll need to teach people to do.
customer_reviews.author: R. Noecker

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with my 3-way lamp
customer_reviews.text: Despite iDevices stating that this product works with 3-way lamps in the "Customer questions & answers" section of the listing, I found that this was not the case. With a 3-way lamp, I found the installation setup to be buggy, and when the Socket finally installed, the lighting and dimming functionality would not work at all. Based on the reviews, I am sure that this works just fine with a single on/off functioning light, but beware that this may not work as advertised with a 3-way lamp. It did not on mine, even though iDevices states that it does.
customer_reviews.author: M. Winterroth

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have configured it to a dimmable led bulb of 1000 lumens/9Watts and it is able to dim the bulb with the iDevices Connect app as well as Google Home. It also has a night light option built into the socket that can be configured independently. However, that works with the App only. It cannot be changed using Google Home(which is a bummer but not a deal breaker).
customer_reviews.author: Saquib Khan

customer_reviews.title: Idevice and Homepod
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!! I jumped on board buying the Apple Homepod hoping it would be just as good as Alexa (but thats an entire different review). The Idevice works very well with Siri. It not only has the main light but has different color night lights as well. Its very responsive with telling Siri to turn on and off. I plan to put more idevices around the house. Goid investment.
customer_reviews.author: Luvlytrinity

customer_reviews.title: Like some of the other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: Like some of the other reviewers, I couldn't get this product to connect to my router. I appreciated the time spent by the customer service tech. She very patient. After an hour of changing security settings on the router, etc, no luck. Apparently there was more that a tech from Linksys might do to help but I'm done. For the record, we have other WiFi devices - outlets, printers, phones, switches. All of them connected as advertised, right out of the box. While there may be a way to make this product work, it shouldn't be this hard. After all it's only a light socket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device to turn any bulb socket into a smart device
customer_reviews.text: Im a huge homekit user. I really love iDevices products, have many of their switches and smart plugs. This bulb adapter is really outstanding. Love the night light on it (wish it was a touch brighter, but no worries) Word of advice, update this immediately before trying to integrate it into your smart home.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: More than an adapter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this adapter so as not to think about the lifetime of a led bulb, although it would lose the change of colors, for my surprise the adapter has led lights that cover the needs of changing colors. The only bad thing I found is that the application that allows you to program some adapter abilities are not available in all regions, including mine.
customer_reviews.author: Fernelys Gómez

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly with Apple HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: Set up was a breeze, though I was briefly confused by the fact that the built in nightlight and the socket show up as separate "accessories" in HomeKit. 4 stars instead of 5 b/c the documentation is much too brief in my opinion. I did have some difficulty with non-responsive status after deleting the nightlight (part of my confusion). I had to delete my "Home" and begin over again from scratch. Working smoothly with Siri as well as the Home app on my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to set up initially, but worth the effort. It works flawlessly with my Amazon Echo, and can be controlled using iPhone's Siri, and several available Apps. Personally, I prefer using my Echo to control my iDevices, it's so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Janice P. Feingold

customer_reviews.title: Socket is very flaky -- disconnects all the time and you have to reset it
customer_reviews.text: Product needs to be reset constantly. I have called their support line and they walk me through the same debugging to get it to connect. It stays connected until app is closed and then when you start up it is not connected. sometimes you can tap on it in app and it connects, other times you have to turn off wifi on phone, then reset modem and then reset and go through connecting procedure for socket. very annoying. I am very close to the modem so wifi strength is not the issue. needs to be a lot more reliable. very frustrating
customer_reviews.author: George A.

customer_reviews.title: The product works
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of idevices products many of which I bought on their web site. I like the fact that you do not need a hub and they are very intuitive and easy to operate. Also the company has excellent customer service and tech support that is located in the United States.
customer_reviews.author: John Donohue

customer_reviews.title: Socket is all wired
customer_reviews.text: The socket works fine, I had no trouble getting it cnnected to my network. I have a xfinity duel band router, I have programmed a set schedule for n and off, works well. Alexa scheduling work well also.
customer_reviews.author: LesD

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great so far! Unfortunately, I purchased an Emberlight that now is useless so in an effort to find a smart socket I purchased the iDevices Socket. This thing is 10 times the product that the Emberlight ever was for roughly the same cost (buying it used via Amazon) and offers way more features.
customer_reviews.author: LilSeizuringBoy

customer_reviews.title: Both boxes were open
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 2 pack and when they arrived, I could tell that the packages were open. It almost looked like a returned item. Usually, there is a round clear sticker on the package. This package had the stickers (seals) but they were all pulled back as if someone had already opened them. I was pissed!!! I installed them any way and they worked fine. I just expect to receive Brand New items when paying full price for them and when listed as NEW...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Annoying
customer_reviews.text: These devices are nice until you have to reset your Wi-Fi in the house for some reason or even change the password on it. Then they all stop working and you have to reinstall them after you completely reset them. This process causes you to lose all of your scheduled settings on the lights or the sockets. It’s very annoying and time-consuming.
customer_reviews.author: BS

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: If you see ppl that put bad reviews IGNORE them they probably didn’t read the directions. Very simple to set up and it multiple ways of doing it can’t get enough slowly equipping my whole house
customer_reviews.author: Matt b

customer_reviews.title: They were easy to install and make work with my IOS devices
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of the sockets. They were easy to install and make work with my IOS devices. Then I made them work with Alexa. The night light can be controlled with Alexa, but can be controlled separately with the Home app on IOS. Both IOS and Alexa are not 100% dependable. Both sometimes takes 2 tries to turn on or off. The IOS works more often on the first try. From the IDevices app it work much better. I got shorter light bulbs so they would fit in the lamp under the shade. I am very happy with these products, and look forward to a switch that will control my ceiling fan.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Took awhile to get around to using it. Sadly ...
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile to get around to using it. Sadly, it doesn't work and my return period has passed. I don't know if it's my android phone, or if it's truly a faulty product. I don't think it's my android, as I have had much success with my phone on other, much cheaper, products. I've reached out to the company for a replacement/refund. If I have any luck working with them, this review will be deleted.
customer_reviews.author: Jason E Forster

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with it. No hub required is not completely true. It does not require a special hub, but it does need a smart device to work. I have an iPad that is always at home and use that as the hub.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: I love the night light feature
customer_reviews.text: I love the night light feature! This is for a flood light above a kitchen sink ... I also put a Hue 4 button switch on the backsplash near the sink to control it ... works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun G.

customer_reviews.title: easy install, No hub needed
customer_reviews.text: easy install, No hub needed, it dims lights and everything i want it to do. Saved a few bucks rather than spending on the Phillips hue which requires the hub and all that crap. so i highly recommend if you want to cut down the clutter of hubs and still work with your alexa device.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: iDevices are wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 thermostats, 2 sockets, 3 switches, and 2 wall switches. They all work perfectly. iDevices support is the best ever.
customer_reviews.author: TopGun

customer_reviews.title: Great device, but it's too tall
customer_reviews.text: I like the device, I have 2 iDevice switches that I love. But the Socket is too tall and causes the bulbs in ALL of my lamps to stick out above the lampshade, almost comically so.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Cornett

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and works without a hitch. I love being able to control my lamp using Siri!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Beck

customer_reviews.title: Trouble shooting
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to pair it with android and is not working after 30 minutes of setting up It doesn't turn the light on or off dimming control doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.author: Jerry.C

customer_reviews.title: Works well...a little large
customer_reviews.text: I started building my smart home automation with iDevices and have been happy with the iDevices I have so far. While the socket is a little larger for my patio light fixture, it still fits and does the features I wanted: timed on/off and integration with Google Assistant.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk B.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best!
customer_reviews.text: very easy to install, easy to set up in the Apple Home app, and easy to operate. The fittings match any common bulb. Very satisfied with the quality of this product. I will definitely buy it again. Hopefully, Seller and Amazon can give free shipping on my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Purnama

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid build quality, flawless performance, and a host of features I was actually surprised to find in the incredibly useful app (another compelling reason to get this).
customer_reviews.author: Scrittore

customer_reviews.title: Ok quality and very useful. Seemd to have some problems connecting with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok quality and very useful. Seemd to have some problems connecting with my phone at first but working now.
customer_reviews.author: RockyRen

customer_reviews.title: wish it had IFTTT but after an exhaustive search this is the best smart socket
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, wish it had IFTTT but after an exhaustive search this is the best smart socket. So far it hasn't let me down. The nightlight is an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Bought open box - but nightlight is defective
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase a used unit that was previously opened to save a little. The nightlight was defective, one LED of the four doesn't set to the same colors as the other three. Just wont plan on using the night light.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Abels

customer_reviews.title: WOW, and I thought the iDevice switch was cool
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm, added it to my bedroom and got easy on/off of my light as well as a really nice soft coloured glow to my bedroom at night before bed.
customer_reviews.author: Xander

customer_reviews.title: Idevice WiFi lamp switch
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm, my 4th idevice installed, so easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Keith H. Wooten

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied customer!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Easy installation! Easy to use! I had to purchase another socket. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device, does not flicker as other sockets
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device, does not flicker as other sockets, it has a night light, and it can be controlled by Alexa Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: We have enjoyed this light/nightlight very much in my son's room and use it to aid falling asleep. Controlled through my iPad, we can adjust the lighting without getting up from reading in bed on the Kindle app.
customer_reviews.author: Tonka

customer_reviews.title: I live the convenience but not pleased with the glitches
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both have the app. We have two. One idevices works on my phone and another does not. I live the convenience but not pleased with the glitches.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Once you paired, the response is very quick.
customer_reviews.text: Once you paired, the response is very quick. The only downside is the light bulb will stick out a little
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does not work on my desk lamp
customer_reviews.text: Somehow it does not work on my desk lamp. Otherwise, it's good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great product - Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This device is easy to setup. Love the dimming feature.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Stopped connecting
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 1 night then stopped being able to be connected to the idevices app
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product/. I keep getting more! they work with all Platforms!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Ugly bulb holder
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked fine but it’s pretty dumb! I set this up with homekit and worked flawlessly but it ultimately is just not going to be useful for me. Basically it’s a ugly bulb that another bulb can go inside :P I would have kept it but if you power the switch on and off it blinks red for a moment then powers the bulb and socket ring 👎. The leds also display as 4 points on the ring rather than a uniform diffused ring.
customer_reviews.author: filmbuff?

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Control!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect solution to timers on outside lights (protected fixtures). It works with Apple Home Kit & TV, plus voice command via Amazon Echo & Apple's Siri. NO HUB or subscription required, just connect to your Wi-Fi & use the iDevices app. Can be controlled away from home, too! Typical hard-wired timer switches are about the same price, but require additional cost for installation (unless you're handy). The iDevices Socket was just what I needed! I plan to order more for other lights. Programming & recipes are easy, even custom color-changing for mood/season, plus dimming capability. iDevices states that dimmable bulbs are recommended for best features results. I'm using LED bulbs (Cree).
customer_reviews.author: speediest

customer_reviews.title: To expensive for the money!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: To expensive for what it does!.. Better to get the Smart light bulbs, you get more for the same prices, I got 3 Light Bulbs for the same price of this Adapter!
customer_reviews.author: Carla Di Paola

customer_reviews.title: So far work well. Update; Sometimes is difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: So far work well. Update; Sometimes is difficult to connect with the device. Second update Don't buy this is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jacek

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Returned it to the manufacturer after having to jump through some hoops to do so. Ended up purchasing a competitor's product.
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: BAD - keeps dropping from wifi network!!!
customer_reviews.text: Kept dropping from my wifi network, even after iDevices customer care had me split up my wifi signal for them. I kept having to re-connect my iDevices products (indoor and outdoor switches and socket) Now my other online wifi items in my house keep dropping from my network. This is more than a pain in the neck - very bad deal. I wish I had never heard of the company iDevices. It's a great idea - but does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Boardman

customer_reviews.title: Only if u are computer savvy will this work. ...
customer_reviews.text: Only if u are computer savvy will this work. Much more involved in seting up to Alexa , then u have to set up to iPhone . To much work never could get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: PATRICIA MEDLIN

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for lights with a shade
customer_reviews.text: I used this device on a ceiling light that has a shade only to find out that it wasn't not able to interact with my iphone once i covered the light bulb with the shade but it worked perfectly when there was no shade over the light bulb. If you intend to use this device on a fancy light that has a shade, it might not work.
customer_reviews.author: jeff jefferson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Keeps disconnecting no matter what I do. Needs a lot more work.
customer_reviews.author: Finse

customer_reviews.title: Great product, work with Apple Home Kit and Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Great product, work with Apple Home Kit and Alexa. If you are worried about the color ring, don't be. You can turn it off. My only problem with it was that I just needed it to turn a light bulb on and off. When you set it up, it wants to dim the light bulb. I just powered through it and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Shelton

product_meta.title: IDEVICES IDEV0002ANP5 Socket-Wi-Fi Light Bulb Adapter Works with HomeKit, Amazon Alexa & The Google Assistant, Small
product_meta.description: Using Apple HomeKit technology, the iDevices Socket allows you to control the power and brightness of any standard light bulb through Siri, Amazon Alexa, or an Android device. Use the free iDevices Connected app to create schedules for your iDevices Socket based on your daily routine, and transform entire rooms with customizable color LEDs. For example, "Goodnight, Alexa” might turn off or change the brightness of the lamps in your home. The iDevices Socket works with standard Edison bulbs up to 60 watts and supports LED, CFL, incandescent, and halogen bulbs. Our dimming feature does require a dimmable bulb.
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (Alexa device sold separately).
REMOTE ACCESS: Control and monitor your lights with the iDevices Socket from anywhere, no hub required

DIMMING CAPABILITY: Works with standard Edison style bulbs up to 60 watts. Supports LED, CFL, incandescent and halogen bulbs. Dimming feature requires dimmable bulb. Socket is compatible with all standard light bulbs with a minimum lamp harp size of 8.5 inches
SCHEDULING: Create unlimited schedules to turn on an off your electronics based on your daily routine. Create a Scene to turn on multiple devices with one command
EASY SETUP: Download the iDevices Connected app, screw in the Socket, scan the unique code. No need to enter Wi-Fi network information.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars147 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
